hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Squeeze Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a confirmed NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%), a sharp, low-volume breakout from a multi-day consolidation range (defined by ATR(14) dropping below its 20th percentile) is likely to fail. Fading the initial 1-hour breakout move (long on false downside break, short on false upside break) provides a high Sharpe ratio timing edge over the subsequent 12-24 hours as price reverts to the consolidation mean.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are defined by mean-reversion and range-bound behavior. Low-volatility squeezes on weak volume are hallmarks of 'false breakouts' driven by illiquidity, not fundamental shifts. This is a classic timing edge for regime-aware strategies.
entry_conditions: Price breaks > 0.8*ATR above/below 3-day consolidation range high/low
Volume on breakout candle is < 120% of prior 10-candle average (low conviction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the prior 3-day consolidation range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves an additional 1.0*ATR in the breakout direction beyond entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in a stop-loss hit before a take-profit, invalidating the 'false breakout' premise.
